channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CT
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for CT

item.title: Report X-2023080871
item.description:
Report X-2023080871

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-10
  • City: MIDDLETOWN
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS REMOVE FROM UNLOAD TRAILER BY AN MANAGER PUT ON A CART THEN BROUGHT TO HAZMAT CAGE DescribePack: DENTS IN THE SIDEWALLS OF THE JERRICANS WEAKENED THE SEEMS CAUSING LEAK DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PUT IN TO A HAZMAT TOTE WITH BAG

item.title: Report X-2023080834
item.description:
Report X-2023080834

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-09
  • City: WILLINGTON
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Pkg was found wet and ripped during loading. Upon discovery the pkg was placed in a lined Hazmat bin and sent to QA where it was later transferred to the Hazmat Processing Area for inspection and reporting. DescribePack: Loose cap on 1 x 2.5 gal plastic bottle. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Pkg placed in lined Hazmat bin.

item.description:
Report X-2023080723

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-04
  • City: WILLINGTON
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Pkg was found to be wet upon unloading. Pkg was placed in a lined Hazmat bin and sent to the Hazmat Processing Area for inspection and reporting. DescribePack: Loose caps allowed liquid to leak and seep through the protective plastic bag wetting and staining the contents and carton/ DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Pkg placed in lined Hazmat bin.

item.title: Report E-2023080840
item.description:
Report E-2023080840

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-07T15:11:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-25
  • City: MERIDEN
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one of the poly 55 gallon drums of fleet cleaner (na1760) had been punctured by a nail and had released 1 cup of product. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.

item.title: Report X-2023080985
item.description:
Report X-2023080985

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-19
  • City: BOZRAH
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PACKAGE FOUND LEAKING, UPON INSPECTION RESPONDER DISCOVERED 4 AEROSOL CANS IN PACKAGE WITH OPEN HAVING CAP COME OFF AND LEAKED. UNDECLARED AEROSOLS CONFIRMED WITH HMSC.

item.title: Report E-2023080774
item.description:
Report E-2023080774

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-05T15:12:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-24
  • City: BRIDGEPORT
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that one of the metal 8 pound cylinders of oxygen(1072) was venting due to a valve that opened during transit and that 8 pounds had been released. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.
